intro: Amyema pendula subsp. pendula, commonly known as the hanging mistflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its delicate, pendulous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they appear in clusters, giving the plant a soft, mist-like appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions.
